body_html:
Did anyone fix this?

We are getting this error (Blas SGEMM launch failed) while trying to learn word2vec embeddings. The code is pretty much the one in the TF tutorial (https://www.tensorflow.org/tutorials/word2vec). It runs without any problem on a regular GPU machine. However, we are trying to run it in a CodaLab setup (http://codalab.org/). The TF docker image is the official one from https://hub.docker.com/r/tensorflow/tensorflow/ specified as: tensorflow/tensorflow:1.0.0-gpu

Since we may be potentially sharing the GPUs, we have:
cfg = tf.ConfigProto(allow_soft_placement=True )
cfg.gpu_options.allow_growth = True
for the config used for the session.

The full error can be seen here:
https://codalab.rollme.ml.cmu.edu/bundles/0x3646a0f2dc614a6a971cbeadf753cf15/

body:
Did anyone fix this? 

We are getting this error (Blas SGEMM launch failed) while trying to learn word2vec embeddings. The code is pretty much the one in the TF tutorial (https://www.tensorflow.org/tutorials/word2vec). It runs without any problem on a regular GPU machine. However, we are trying to run it in a CodaLab setup (http://codalab.org/). The TF docker image is the official one from https://hub.docker.com/r/tensorflow/tensorflow/ specified as: tensorflow/tensorflow:1.0.0-gpu

Since we may be potentially sharing the GPUs, we have: 
cfg = tf.ConfigProto(allow_soft_placement=True )
cfg.gpu_options.allow_growth = True
for the config used for the session.

The full error can be seen here: 
https://codalab.rollme.ml.cmu.edu/bundles/0x3646a0f2dc614a6a971cbeadf753cf15/
